oai_dc:dc.dc:title: TIME-AVERAGED WAVE FIELD EVOLUTION IN COASTAL ZONE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Xu, Jianlu
Sobey, Rodney J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coastal zone
wave field
field evolution
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Flow circulation and the field variation of wave height and setup are important data in coastal engineering practice. This paper presents a wave-averaged model for simulating wave transformation and associated mean flow circulation in coastal regions. It is intended for applications where interest centers on the evolution of wave-averaged parameters such as wave height, setup and wave-induced current, and where the resolution ofwave phase is unnecessary.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
